memberdef.argsstring: (String name, ExtendedLength xPos, ExtendedLength yPos, ExtendedLength zPos)
memberdef.name: addEntryPoint

detaileddescription.para:
Gets a 4x4 matrix back which represents the coordinates of the SpatialObject.
The double[4][4] where the result will be stored. Adds an entry point to this SpatialObject. The given position should refer to the local coordinates of this SpatialObject.
name
The name of this entry point.
xPos
The x-position of this entry point in local coordinates.
yPos
The y-position of this entry point in local coordinates.
zPos
The z-position of this entry point in local coordinates.

memberdef.argsstring: (String name, ExtendedLength xPos, ExtendedLength yPos, ExtendedLength zPos)
memberdef.name: addExitPoint

detaileddescription.para: Adds an exit point to this SpatialObject. The given position should refer to the local coordinates of this SpatialObject.

parameterdescription.para: The name of this exit point.
The x-position of this exit point in local coordinates.
The y-position of this exit point in local coordinates.
The z-position of this exit point in local coordinates.

detaileddescription.para:
Gets a set of names of all the entry points this SpatialObject contains.
A set of names of the entry points.

Gets a set of names of all the exit points this SpatialObject contains.
A set of names of the exit points.

Gets the position of the given entry point.
name
The name of the entry point.
The position of the entry point in local coordinates. The first element of the array represents the x-position, the second the y-position and the third the z-position. It returns null if the SpatialObject doesn't contain the entry point with the given name.

Gets the position of the entry point in global coordinates.
name
The name of the entry point.
The position of the entry point in global coordinates. The first element of the array represents the x-position, the second the y-position and the third the z-position. It returns null if the SpatialObject doesn't contain the entry point with the given name.

Gets the position of the given exit point.
name
The name of the exit point.
The position of the exit point in local coordinates. The first element of the array represents the x-position, the second the y-position and the third the z-position. It returns null if the SpatialObject doesn't contain the exit point with the given name.

Gets the position of the exit point in global coordinates.
name
The name of the exit point.
The position of the exit point in global coordinates. The first element of the array represents the x-position, the second the y-position and the third the z-position. It returns null if the SpatialObject doesn't contain the exit point with the given name.

Gets a 4x4 double matrix object which contains the spatial data of the SpatialObejct.
The Matrix4d object.

Returns the name of the named object. This is the same name displayed in reports and trace files when this named object is shown in those reports or trace files.
The name of the named object.

simplesect.para: It returns the x-position of the object.
It returns the y-position of the object.
It returns the z-position of the object.

detaileddescription.para:
Check whether this Object is a MovableSpatialObject or not.
Return true if this SpatialObject is also a MovableSpatialObject. Else, false.
Resets the rotation of the object.

Adds a rotation about the x-axis to the current orientation.
angle
The rotation angle in radians

Adds a rotation about the y-axis to the current orientation.
angle
The rotation angle in radians

Adds a rotation about the z-axis to the current orientation.
angle
The rotation angle in radians

Update the current spatial data of the object. This method should only be used for the internal coordination, not for the position/orientation manipulation. The method will change the 3D properties of the SpatialObject. But the visualization instance, if used, won't be informed about the change. Therefore the visualization won't be updated. Inconsistency could be the result.
matrix
The new matrix in a double[16] for the object. The first 4 elements are the first row, the next 4 are the second row etc. Update the current spatial data of the object. This method should only be used for the internal coordination, not for the position/orientation manipulation. The method will change the 3D properties of the SpatialObject. But the visualization instance, if used, won't be informed about the change. Therefore the visualization won't be updated. Inconsistency could be the result.
matrix
The new matrix in Matrix4d. It sets the new position for the object. *
x
The ExtendedLength which contains the new x-position.
y
The ExtendedLength which contains the new y-position.
z
The ExtendedLength which contains the new z-position.

The basic interface of the SpatialObject. It contains simple setting and getting methods of coordinates for every visible object in the simulation. Every SpatialObject may contain several or none entry or exit point. They define the specific coordinates where an MovableSpatialObject move to or get out, if they navigate into or out of this SpatialObject.
